partnership_model: 70/30 revenue split (creator favor), mutual promotion, audience engagement tool

research_first: Watch 3-5 videos to understand their style
Note specific moments you can reference
Check audience size and engagement rate
Identify their pain points (content gaps, audience engagement)
personalization_critical: Explain why THIS partnership makes sense for THEM
follow_up_sequence: Follow-up after 3 days if no response
Move on after that - don't be pushy

music_streamer_twitch.target: Twitch/YouTube streamers who review or play music

version_a.message:
Hey [Name],

I've been watching your streams for a few weeks now - your breakdown of [specific artist/album] last Tuesday was spot on, especially what you said about [specific point].

I built something that could add a whole new layer to your shows.

It's called Frequency Factory. Think of it as a gamified A&R platform that runs alongside your stream.

Here's how it works with your content:

**PRE-SHOW:** Your community rates tracks before you go live. Creates hype, gives them something to do between streams.

**DURING SHOW:** You review the top-rated tracks live. Real-time engagement, instant feedback from the community, they see their ratings influence your content.

**POST-SHOW:** Factory stays active after you sign off. Keeps your audience engaged 24/7, even when you're not streaming.

Why this works:
- Your audience gets rewarded for engagement (tokens, ranks, badges)
- You always have quality tracks to review (community pre-filters)
- Artists pay for submissions (we split 70/30 in your favor)
- Your community grows stickier - they're invested even when you're offline

I'm not asking you to change your content. I'm offering a tool that amplifies what you already do.

No cost to you. Just value add.

Interested in a quick call to see if this fits your show?

Drop a reply or DM me.

- [Your Name]
Founder, Frequency Factory

[Link to platform demo]
[Link to partnership deck]
version_a.follow_up_1:
(Day 3)

Hey [Name],

I know you're busy so I'll keep this short.

Frequency Factory = engagement tool for your music stream.
- Community rates tracks
- You review top ones
- Everyone earns rewards
- 70/30 split in your favor

Worth a 15-min call?

Let me know.
version_a.follow_up_2:
(Day 7)

Last message, I promise!

If Frequency Factory isn't a fit for your show, totally cool - I respect that.

But if you're at all curious, here's a 2-minute video showing exactly how it integrates with streams: [VIDEO LINK]

Either way, keep doing what you're doing. Your content is great.

Cheers,
[Name]

version_b_casual.message:
Yo [Name],

[Specific compliment about recent content].

Got a partnership idea. Think "always-on lobby/afterparty for your stream."

Basically:
- Your audience rates music 24/7
- You review top tracks on stream
- They earn tokens/ranks/badges
- Everyone gets addicted
- You make money from submissions (70/30 your favor)

No cost. Just value. Amplifies your existing content.

Wanna see how it works? 15-min call?

Hit me back.

- [Name]

youtube_music_reviewer.target: YouTubers who do track reviews, reaction videos, or music commentary

template.message:
Hi [Name],

Your [recent video title] showed up in my recommendations last week. The way you broke down [specific element] at [timestamp] was exactly the kind of analysis the music community needs more of.

I'm reaching out because I think there's a natural collaboration between your channel and Frequency Factory.

Quick context: Frequency Factory is a gamified platform where your audience can rate tracks, earn rewards, and help discover new artists. Think SubmitHub meets Twitch culture.

How this could work with your channel:

**CONTENT PIPELINE:**
1. Artists submit tracks to Frequency Factory
2. Your audience rates them (Hook Strength + Production Quality)
3. Top-rated tracks become your review videos
4. Your reviews drive more engagement on the platform

Result: You always have quality content to review (community pre-filters), your audience is engaged between uploads, and you earn from submissions.

**REVENUE:**
- Artists pay to submit tracks ($10-50 depending on tier)
- You get 70% of submission fees for tracks you review
- Platform handles all payments, tracking, logistics

**ENGAGEMENT:**
- Your community gets tokens, ranks, badges
- They're invested in your content (their ratings matter)
- Stickier audience, better retention

**YOUR WORKLOAD:**
- Zero change to your content style
- Just review tracks the community already validated
- We handle all tech/support

I'm not trying to change what you do. You're already great at it. I'm just offering infrastructure that makes it easier and more profitable.

Worth exploring?

I put together a partnership deck that shows exactly how this works: [LINK]

Or we can hop on a quick call if you prefer to talk through it.

Let me know your thoughts.

Best,
[Your Name]
Founder, Frequency Factory

[Platform Link]
[Partnership Deck]
[Calendar Link for Meeting]
template.follow_up:
(Day 4)

Hey [Name],

Following up on my partnership message from earlier this week.

I know you get a ton of these, so I'll be direct:

Frequency Factory = pre-filtered track submissions + engaged community + revenue share.

If that sounds interesting, check out this deck: [LINK]

If not, no worries - I respect your time.

Either way, keep making great content.

- [Name]

template.message:
Hi [Name],

I've been listening to [Podcast Name] for a while now - your interview with [guest] was particularly insightful, especially the discussion about [specific topic].

I'm the founder of Frequency Factory, a gamified music discovery platform that's changing how unsigned artists get discovered. I think there's both a great guest segment AND a partnership opportunity here.

**AS A GUEST:**
I can talk about:
- The broken music discovery system (and how we're fixing it)
- Gamification in the music industry
- How community-driven A&R works
- Data insights from 10,000+ track ratings
- The future of artist discovery

**AS A PARTNER:**
Your podcast listeners could use Frequency Factory to:
- Rate tracks you discuss on the show
- Discover artists before you feature them
- Earn rewards for engagement
- Influence what music you cover

Revenue opportunity: 70/30 split on artist submissions that come through your show's community.

I'm not pitching you hard here - just wanted to put both options on your radar. Happy to do either, both, or neither depending on what makes sense for your show.

If you're interested in the guest segment, here's my background: [BRIEF BIO WITH CREDENTIALS]

If you're interested in the partnership, here's the deck: [LINK]

Or we can just hop on a call and chat about music industry stuff. I'm flexible.

Let me know what sounds interesting.

Best,
[Your Name]
Founder, Frequency Factory

[Platform Link]
[LinkedIn/Social Proof]
template.follow_up:
(Day 5)

Hey [Name],

Circling back on my email about guesting on [Podcast Name] / partnering with Frequency Factory.

Either avenue works for me. Or happy to just connect and chat shop about the music industry if you're interested in what we're building.

Let me know if any of that resonates.

Thanks,
[Name]

partnership_deck_outline.slide_1: Hook - "What if your audience could make money discovering music?"
partnership_deck_outline.slide_2: The Problem - Audience engagement drops between content, artists waste money on useless submissions
partnership_deck_outline.slide_3: The Solution - Frequency Factory as always-on engagement tool
partnership_deck_outline.slide_4: How It Works - 3-phase model (pre-show, live, post-show)
partnership_deck_outline.slide_5: Revenue Model - 70/30 split, artist submission fees breakdown
partnership_deck_outline.slide_6: Your Benefits - Content pipeline, engaged audience, passive revenue
partnership_deck_outline.slide_7: Audience Benefits - Tokens, ranks, badges, influence
partnership_deck_outline.slide_9: Integration - How easy it is to implement
partnership_deck_outline.slide_10: Next Steps - Calendar link for partnership call

DO: Research the creator thoroughly before reaching out
Explain the value to THEM, not to you
Make the next step easy (calendar link, deck)
Follow up 2 times max, then move on
DONT: Focus on your needs instead of theirs
Make them do work to understand your offer
Disparage other platforms or tools they use

success_metrics.focus: Quality over quantity - better to partner with 5 great creators than 50 mediocre ones
